page.title: 11Forms of Transport
page.content: There is no local public transport in the area;a loal GWR Branch line closed in 1966.There are no scheduled bus routes,only a long distance coach to London or Bristol along the A361. From the Oakford area a Community bus goes weekly to market at Tiverton & will call at farms if asked to by telephone.Dulverton Community bus goes weekly to Minehead and monthly to South Molton. Farmers hire lorries to take animals to markets or sales;most have cars, tractors and land rovers,some also run a van or pickup truck.Some households own horse-boxes.Only three cottages have no motorised transport, one of these using cycles.Altogether there were probably over 50 cars,about 6 landrovers,several vans and trucks,5 motorbikes and 6 bicycles,1 motorbike used for motocross.Tractors used too.
